meanings.definition: Granting a new license for something that has already been licensed.
meanings.sent1: The company will be relicensing their software for the latest version.
meanings.sent2: The government agency is relicensing all the approved businesses in the area.
meanings.sent3: After many years, the relicensing of the old patents brought a sense of renewal.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like relicensing their creativity after a long break.
meanings.sent5: The process of relicensing the product was smoother than expected.

meanings.definition: The act of renewing or extending a license.
meanings.sent1: The relicensing of the driver's license was a quick procedure.
meanings.sent2: The relicensing of the software was necessary to continue its use.
meanings.sent3: The relicensing of the library card brought a sigh of relief to the avid reader.
meanings.sent4: The relicensing of the contract ensured the partnership would continue smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The relicensing of the permit was crucial for the construction project to proceed.

meanings.definition: The process of obtaining a new license for a previously licensed entity.
meanings.sent1: The relicensing of the trademark required careful documentation.
meanings.sent2: The relicensing of the franchise was a lengthy but necessary step.
meanings.sent3: The relicensing of the business brought a fresh start to the entrepreneur.
meanings.sent4: The relicensing of the property was a bureaucratic hurdle to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The relicensing of the certification opened up new opportunities for the professional.
